messages.content: ComfyUI-layerdiffuse is a ComfyUI implementation of the LayerDiffuse model for generating images and videos with customizable extensions.

To install ComfyUI-layerdiffuse, download the repository and unpack it into the custom_nodes folder in the ComfyUI installation directory, or clone via GIT by running the command 'cd custom_nodes && git clone git@github.com:huchenlei/ComfyUI-layerdiffuse.git' in the ComfyUI installation directory.
What should be done if there is a version conflict on diffusers while installing ComfyUI-layerdiffuse?
In case of version conflict on diffusers due to other extensions that depend on other versions of diffusers, it is recommended to setup separate Python venvs.
What are the workflows supported by ComfyUI-layerdiffuse?

ComfyUI-layerdiffuse supports various workflows such as generating foreground, blending foreground/background, extracting foreground/background from blended images, and generating foreground from blended/background images.
What are the supported models by ComfyUI-layerdiffuse?
Currently, SDXL/SD15 are the supported models by ComfyUI-layerdiffuse, as per https://github.com/layerdiffuse/sd-forge-layerdiffuse#model-notes.
Can you explain the unique features of ComfyUI-layerdiffuse?

ComfyUI-layerdiffuse offers unique features such as generating images with RGBA channels, blending images, extracting foreground/background, and compatibility with various models and workflows for increased customization.
What is the requirement for decoding RGBA results in ComfyUI-layerdiffuse?
For decoding RGBA results in ComfyUI-layerdiffuse, the generation dimension must be a multiple of 64. Otherwise, a decode error may occur.
